results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Churchill Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.
results.title_for_label: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm’s fairy tale

results.title: Circus
results.brief_description: Documentary about life on the road with the Swiss Circus Royale as it tours outback Australia. Intercuts performance scenes with shots of the less glamorous aspects of circus life. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Getting the message
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Dramatization of the difficulties faced by an illiterate adult in employment and social situations. Suggests that with concern and adequate teaching methods this problem can be overcome. The film highlights the plight of the hundreds of illiterate Australian adults.

results.title: For Better - For Worse
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale, Don Anderson and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Dramatization of common misconceptions surrounding marriage and the types of stress contributing to marriage breakdown. Refers to alcohol, the consequences of “mateship” and violence.

results.title: Casting iron plow-shares
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mountain peoples of Central Asia”.
This film presents Tajik men of Afghanistan performing the several stages that shape, mould and cast, in wet sands, their iron plow-shares. It explains how over the centuries this ancient craft has achieved economy of action and perfect timing. No narration - traditional music accompaniament. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Circus nomads
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This film aims to portray the circus as a nomadic way of life, to give viewers a deeper insight into aspects of circus life, and to show the circus as a form of theatre where the clown is king.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.

results.title: Destination: Port of Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Norman Godbold and Pan Pacific Pictures
